titlestmt.titleproper: Lue Osborne and Cordray Simmons papers

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 16:24:31 -0400.

did.unittitle: Lue Osborne and Cordray Simmons papers

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Archives of American art does not own the original papers. Use is limited to the microfilm copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters to Osborne and Simmons from friends, gallery owners, and colleagues, among others, including some about their use of synthetic resin paints; 83 photographs; 70 clippings, catalogs, essays and other printed materials. Correspondents include H. Daniel Webster, F. Valentine Dudensing, Walter M. Grant, Robert Henri, and Onya LaTour. Also included is one letter from Thomas Hart Benton to Mrs. Brett Osborne, daughter in law of Lue and Cordray. She had inherited their paintings and asked Benton's advice what to do with them.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel 1126 available at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals returned to the lender, Signature Galleries, after microfilming.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Painter; New York City; b. 1889, Belleville, Ill.; d. 1968 Osborne's husband, Cordray Simmons, is also a painter; discovered with her husband "vinyl lite," a new kind of acrylic paint

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Lent for microfilming 1976 by Signature Galleries.
